question: I dreamed about Mars again... it was bizarre, yet is was so real...
answer: It's your time of the month again. At least once a month. Douglas Quail's obsession. For twelve years you've been talking about Mars.

question: People do go to Mars, you know.
answer: That's right, Douglas. But not you. Not us. As it is, we can barely scrape by on your lousy ten thousand a week. What do they expect ... the way men dress these days ... then they scream rape.

question: You know -- let's really do it.
answer: Rape men in the park?

question: No. Go to Mars.
answer: Go to hell.

question: We can pool our savings and I've got some sick leave coming, besides my regular vacation...
answer: ...more of a half-wit. For a start a war could break out there any day ...

question: That's just media talk. They're... ...just a minority. They're powerless.
answer: Well, there's a lot of things we need around here before we waste our money on a trip to Mars. We're broke. I'm just a slave around this dump. Now if you were capable of finding a better job....

question: Now, just relax, kid. This ain't gonna hurt. Just a controlled drip of Narkadine. When you're under, I'll just ask ya a few questions, nothin' real personal, just full details of yer private life so's we can tailor the wish-fulfillment program to your needs. See? Painless. I didn't feel a thing. Hey, you're a nice kid... you like a little somethin' extra? Good! Kid -- have I got a girl for you! She's gonna like you. You're good-lookin'. Gettin' sleepy? Good. Now, what's the first thing you think of when you're thinkin' about Mars?
answer: Well... I'd like to see the Martian Sphinx...

question: Okay -- you will, Dougle! I want ya to start counting backwards from a hundred for me.
answer: One hundred... ninety-nine... ninety-eight... ninety-seven... ninety-six... ninety-five....

question: Dougie? This Sophie Lull. Can ya hear me?
answer: ...Sophie....

question: Good! ... I'm gonna ask ya a few more questions now. Ya think you'll be able to answer 'em?
Attaboy! To begin with, I wanna ask ya; -- You sex life. How many orgasms a week? Howie? Listen, you'd better get in here. You'd better get in here. Quail? Dougie, can you hear me?
answer: Yes.

question: Tell McClane what you told us.
answer: All of you in this room are dead. You've broken my cover.

question: Where am I?
answer: Travelling south along Third Avenue, passing Fourty-third street.

question: Where am I going?
answer: Thirty-three thirteen "G" Street, Sector "L", Twin Towers, Apartment six-thirty- five.

question: How did I get here?
answer: I don not understand the question, sir or madam.

question: How did I get into this cab?
answer: You stepped into it in the normal manner, sir or madam.

question: Aren't you the man from Mars?
answer: Mr. Zimmer...Mr. Zimmer... help me... they're... Where are you taking me?

question: You told everyone at Rekall about you trip to Mars. Where you went, who you worked for, what you did --
answer: But I didn't... Are you telling me... I did go to Mars? I don't remember?

question: You've remembered too much. The Sphinx Project, for a start....
answer: Sphinx?... No, no, I don't, I... What about the people at Rekall? I don't recall Rekall but you said if they know what I did? Why don't you ask them? They'll tell you I didn't...

question: They've been taken care of.
answer: What do you mean? What are you going to do with me?

question: Get in the car.
answer: My God! No! You're going to kill me!

question: No one's going to kill you if We're visiting E.I.O. for some new tests. Now get in, or do we start playing rough?
answer: No! It's not my fault! You can't do it! Wait a minute, I remember --

question: What, Quail? What do you remember?
answer: On Mars... they tried to kill me... And.... Did you know I've been to Mars?

question: On Mars... they tried to kill me... And.... Did you know I've been to Mars?
answer: What! This stupid obsess...

question: I think I've been. I vaguely recall...
answer: Doug, you've got to forget...

question: Forget? Remembering is the problem I must've been to one of those artificial memory places...
answer: Oh my God...

question: But something went wrong... something about a real memory... and then those men... tried to kill me.
answer: What men? Doug, you're crazy. You're here now. They didn't kill you.

question: No. That's what's so amazing. I killed them. I think...
answer: Where? Where are they? Doug! It's something they put into your mind at the memory place. Fantasies. That's their business. You're a computer operator. You're a bore. You're a wimp. You're not a killer.

question: I'm involved somehow with E.I.O. It's true. It's no fantasy.
answer: Doug, I want you to see a doctor. Now Alec and Shirley Turnbull have a good man. He helped Alec through his breakdown.

question: For fuck's sake, this is no breakdown! My God! Did you say I need a psychiatrist?
answer: I haven't seen you move that fast since I've known you.

question: How could you do it? After eight years!
answer: I'm not your wife, Quail.

question: Not my wife! You are out of your mind.
answer: It's a false memory implant. I never saw you before six weeks ago.

question: Why are you lying like this?
answer: No, Quail. It's true. You work for E.I.O. So do I.

question: But why all of this?
answer: We had to watchdog you...make sure the erasure took. A wife seemed like a good idea.

question: But I remember it! All of it!... Us!
answer: All implanted.

question: Our friends... my work... eight years.
answer: The job's real -- you've had is six weeks -- since you got back from Mars. It's all a fabrication, Quail. Everything you know.

question: This is crazy! If all my memories are false, who am I? What am I? Jesus... it's like I don't exist.
answer: You exist, all right. That's the problem.

question: Why did you try to kill me? Why does E.I.O. want me dead?
answer: They don't particularly. That was my idea. This assignment was boring me to death. The personality they gave you wasn't too thrilling.

question: Well, what did I do on Mars that they have to keep me from telling?
answer: I've no idea. I just work here.

question: All right... I'm leaving. Don't try and follow me --
answer: I don't have to follow you. You can't get away from E.I.O. Nobody does.

question: A room for the night. Here's ten thousand. Forget the ID. I have a liaison with a lady... and I'm married... I told you, I don't want to be disturbed.
answer: If you want to live, don't hand up. They've got you bugged... They're gonna find you. Faster than you can say "Back Rodgers". And don't bother shaking down your clothes -- the monitor is embedded in your skull.

question: Who are you? What the hell is this?
answer: Take a wet towel and wrap it around your head. That will deaden the signal. It'll take longer for them to pinpoint you.

question: Why should I trust you?
answer: There's a real old saying - "Beggars can't be choosers". Go and soak your head!

question: Keep talking.
answer: Head over to Skid Row -- to the Lucky Stub Pawnshop -- corner of Park Avenue and Fifty-eighth. Tell the man you're Mr. Hotchkiss; you came for your Grecian candlesticks.

question: What do I want with Grecian candlesticks!
answer: Just do it! This is no time for small talk.

question: How did you know where to find me?
answer: I've been tailing you since you get back from Mars.

question: You're E.I.O. You're on the other team.
answer: I'm E.I.O. But I was your best friend. Scott Stevens - we arranged this...

question: I can't remember - only bits...
answer: I was your fail-safe -- if and when the shooting started. Good luck. Look me up if you remember me.

question: It's no Garden of Eden. What do you know about that? Yeah. Got destroyed in the Arab wars... What about this independence movement? Sure. Douglas Quail. Prejudiced? Against what? What are they singing?
answer: Nice to have you back with us, Mr. Hauser.

question: Nice to be back. I'm flattered you remember me.
answer: Part of my job, sir.

question: Do you remember my first name, too?
answer: Charles. Charles Hauser, right?

question: I'm impressed. Listen. I need transportation to the... uh... the Sphinx. Can you arrange it for me?
answer: I'm sorry, sir. But Earth government has sealed off the excavation site completely. No one but survey teams and archaeologists are allowed closer than twenty miles. Oh... Do you want the item you left with us?

question: What item? Oh... yes, please.
answer: Mine's right around the corner.

question: That one's closer.
answer: But I out-hustle him, right?

question: Right. What is this, Bennie... Tombstone?
answer: Sorta. Bunch of miners out here got their own claims, from way back. Cohaagen's buyin' em all up, says he's gonna cut off the air an' water if they won't sell...

question: I'm looking for Melina Noel.
answer: You bastard! You bastard... That's new -- the innocent look. You didn't have that one before. Well?

question: Well, uh... I...
answer: All right, I'll say it for you. Don't worry. I got the note. You discharged your obligation.

question: What note?
answer: Oh, the usual one. "Must return immediately to Earth... the wife needs me..."

question: I don't have a wife. Well, I do - but not a real wife. Hell... look... someone else sent that note. Someone who --
answer: What are you here for?!

question: For you! I don't even know why -- Whoever I was, I must have been a helluva guy.
answer: "Whoever you were"???

question: Listen. I've for to tell you something. I beg you to believe me... help me -- Something happened to my mind. Memory suppression, false implant, I don't know what -- What I'm saying is... I don't remember you. I don't remember us. I don't remember me -- Who is us?
answer: Memory erasure is what they use on agents. Go away.

question: Wait... I was an agent -- I'm not now -- just tell me who I am! How did we know each other? Why are they trying to kill me?!
answer: I'm not trusting you again.

question: You loved me once, you must have --
answer: That you was a liar. Who you are now I don't even know.

question: Please, Melina --
answer: Get out!

question: I need your help --
answer: Get out! Get the hell away from me!

question: You don't look so good, boss. All over the Universe, women is an awful curse. It's a tough planet, boss.
answer: Yeah, right.

question: Some guy really screwed her - screwed her up real good. Some Earthman. Just hopped on a space shuttle.
answer: Listen, Bennie. You're pretty well informed?

question: If that means I know it all, you're right, boss.
answer: What do you know about the Sphinx?

question: I don't know nothin'. Not about the Sphinx. That's out of the ball park.
answer: I have to get there. Can't you help me?

question: No can do, mon. You want women, cigarettes, red-market money, booze, even air or water... Bennie's your man. But the Sphinx... that's Well... look at that one, eh?
answer: What?

question: Big cheese in town. Big smelly cheese.
answer: Cohaagen? But isn't he often here?

question: Mr. Hauser...
answer: Who is it?

question: Mr. Hauser, I want to talk to you... about Douglas Quail.
answer: Who are you?

question: My name is George Edgemar. I work for Rekall, Incorporated.
answer: Rekall??

question: Hello, Mr. Quail. May I come in? I won't be offended if you prefer to keep the gun you're holding trained on me.
answer: All right... come in.

question: My card, Mr. Quail.
answer: Okay -- so you're Doctor George Edgemar of 'Rekall, Inc.' So?

question: As I said... this is going to be very difficult -- for both of us.
answer: I'm listening.

question: Mr. Quail... I'm afraid you're not really standing here at this moment.
answer: Sat that again.

question: I said, you're not really here. Neither am I. We're both in the Memory Studio -- in the offices of Rekall, Inc. On Earth.
answer: Are you trying to tell me that this is all part of some... artificially injected fantasy? That I never really left Earth?

question: No, not quite. We didn't give you this. You're creating it yourself -- Remember the option we offered you? Intelligence agent? Something inside you liked that idea, fastened on it. What you're experiencing now is a free-form delusion that you yourself are fabricating.
answer: What is this shit you're giving me?

question: This is not -- shit, Mr. Quail. It's the truth. I know it's very hard for you to accept, but you're having a schizophrenic reaction... we can't snap you out of the Narkadine. You're in a world of your own fantasy.
answer: Then how the hell can you be in my dream -- if you know it's just a dream?

question: I've been artificially implanted -- like the first part of your fantasy. I'm actually monitoring your dream at a psychoprobe console. This is a last resort. When somebody gets stuck in their own fantasy, we send in someone after them. A specialist, like myself.
answer: I don't believe a word you're saying.

question: All right. Here comes the weapon. Back in, quick! In! Okay. Answers! Now!
answer: They kidnapped me. Said they'd kill you if I didn't cooperate. I told them I didn't care, but then when I realized they meant it...

question: I don't know why they're after me, but what's your connection with all this?
answer: We were together before.

question: Believe me, I'm really sorry I can't recall the details of that encounter.
answer: Go, Bennie, for God's sake!

question: Black cruiser just pull out behind us. Forget the shooter, boss. I lose 'em for you.
answer: Lose them? In this?

question: Hang on!
answer: (shouts over

question: What's all this?
answer: Nothin', boss. Just old smokies. Only place they can come for a puff. It's all banned topside.

question: So you two are into something a bit more serious than the taxi and truck-stop business.
answer: That's right, boss.

question: My God!... T-shirts. They died out on Earth years ago.
answer: Well, maybe we ain't fashion leaders, boss.

question: No. But we still believe in a free Mars.
answer: So where did I fit into all this?

question: You - when you were Charles Hauser with E.I.O - infiltrated our group. I guess Cohaagen didn't trust you any more when you and
answer: Yeah. And I can't even remember it. We'll have to arrange a return bout.

question: ...so he had your memory wiped and fixed you up with a new identity.
answer: But - the Sphinx. Why is that stuck in my mind? Why's it so important?

question: It's more than that, Bennie, I know it's more. Somehow it's connected.
answer: Maybe there's a way you can get your memory back.

question: How? What? Where? When?
answer: A bit of Martian Wisdom. We're not all stupid colonists. He's doing it!

question: What? Why?
answer: Clearing everyone out! It's been rumored for months...

question: Wow. I can see why I was willing to betray E.I.O.
answer: I though you believed in our cause?

question: Yes. Of course. That, too. What use is this weirdo?
answer: Ssssh...there are skills on mars that Earth has forgotten.

question: That's right. Air and water. Terriforming will create a permanent livable environment for Mars. No more pressurized cities, no more containers in the desert. There'll be rivers, vegetation - life - the same as Earth.
answer: So why is Cohaagen shipping everyone out?

question: Don't you see?! From being a pile of red dirt with minerals, Mars is going to change into a chunk of priceless real estate.
answer: And Cohaagen's going to own it all!

question: Right! He can start selling it off to well-heeled investors from Earth. Beach condos, ski resorts, you name it.
answer: No wonder he wanted you to... penetrate... out group.

question: Once word of this gets out, the whole planet will support you.
answer: So what can we do?

question: Ruin his little scheme by terriforming ahead of schedule - while the inhabitants are still here.
answer: But who'll work the machine? Do you know how?

question: I'm the only one who does. Why do you think Cohaagen's left me alone all this time? I was the first one inside when they cracked the riddle of the Sphinx. It must've been programmed. Some kind of...force...shot into me.
answer: But Cohaagen wiped your memory!!!

question: We got in with this thing, but we'll never get back out.
answer: A shame. Such a pleasant trip. This is the main tap -- straight down to the core of Mars. When we trigger the mechanism, fusion reactors will detonate down there -- four hundred miles deep.

question: Remind me not to slip.
answer: The new elements will come booming up through this shaft -- and six thousand others all around the planet.

question: Where'd you get that little trick?
answer: Mail-order company. It's a great one for fooling the wife.

question: If Quail's the only one who can operate all this... ...then he can call all the shots.
answer: We'll tell him the computer's worked out the operational details so we don't really need him. We're just doing him a favor.

question: And if that doesn't work?
answer: We offer him rewards.

question: What if that doesn't work?
answer: We'll torture him. You don't think I got this far by being a nice guy? Seal the breach! Repressurize!
